meanings.definition: The suppression or prohibition of any parts of books, films, news, etc. that are considered obscene, politically unacceptable, or a threat to security.
meanings.sent1: Censorship in the movie removed all the bad words.
meanings.sent2: The government imposed censorship on the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The strict censorship in the library made finding spicy stories impossible.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had a censorship filter, blocking out negative thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The censorship of the internet made it hard to research freely.

meanings.sent1: The censorship of the play was controversial.
meanings.sent2: She was responsible for the censorship of inappropriate content.
meanings.sent3: The cat performed censorship on the mouse's escape plan.
meanings.sent4: His editing was like a censorship of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's red pen acted as a censorship on errors.
